title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: There are two rounds of interviews. On the first day, there will be one round of solo behavioral interviews. Team case study and team behavioral interview on the second day
Interview Questions: What is your strength? weakness?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at James Madison University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: M.Ed School counseling track: mostly focused on group work. Only asked a few personal questions and a short writing prompt. Very chill and kind people. Still got waitlisted though but they only accept about 10 peopel
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a school counselor?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: There are two rounds of interviews. The first-round interview is about 45 minutes. They ask you questions and share information about JMU and the position/department. The flyout takes a full day.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching experience? What course can you teach? Can you tell us about your job market paper?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Full out a survey and need to demonstrate academic excellence in all relevant classes that you will be a TA for. As long as you are passionate and our good at communicating you will get it.
Interview Questions: Why you want to be a TA?

title: Linker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: had an individual interview and group interview. They give you a situation and see how you solve it. You will talk with other candidates in the group interview. they tried to make you comfortable and not overwhelming.
Interview Questions: we invited a speaker for today event. How can you make sure he find the location well. how would you navigate him?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to a preliminary Zoom interview, with a panel of 14 people included. It was scheduled and then they asked me to reschedule, which I was able to do. It was a 30 minute call, and approximately 8 questions with follow-up questions.
Interview Questions: They asked several managerial questions and some DEI related questions. I sent a brief thank you note and never heard back from them... not even an auto message from HR.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were very pleasant and casual; it made the interview process much less stressful. The questions asked weren't confusing or misleading. They also clearly answered any questions or concerns I had as well.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your confidence in x field?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Great! Very professional and straight to the point. There were 5 people in the initial interview. The questions were very job specific and thought provoking, which is something that needs to be prepared for. Otherwise, it was all pretty standard interview questions.
Interview Questions:
Why JMU?
Experience 
Why should we hire you?

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions just are friendly and customer service oriented. There is a role play part that you need to be serious with. Troubleshooting problems and questions. Easy interview. No need to stress about it.
Interview Questions: What are 3 words to describe you?

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and quick, great customer service, in addition, the onboard process was very quick. The paperwork came very quickly after as well. The scheduling of the interview was prompt.
Interview Questions: What would you be able to contribute?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at James Madison University (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions, mainly on experience and expected salary. The interviewer was friendly and open to discuss terms. I found it very cordial but it was a lovely experience as such
Interview Questions: Name the  discipline you are good in and why

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well! Very laid back and easy going group of people to interview with and I enjoyed the experience. Definitely come prepared and know what questions to ask at the end to show that you’re interested in the role and going to do your best.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness? ( Typical stuff )

title: Horticulturist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Brief by demanding, just wish I had more time to answer the questions.  If I did, I'm sure I would have gotten the job.  Maybe next time I will get more time to answer
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Department Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Due to covid had my interview was held over a zoom call with six staff members.   They went round table asking different questions, process went very smoothly and professional.
Interview Questions: Tell me what drew you to be interested in a job at JMU

title: Career Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: A Simple interview with about eight to ten questions that go along with basic job responsibilities. It was very laid back and conducted on zoom at a time convenient for everyone. The interview lasted about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: What are two things you think you would do well in this job? What are two things you think you would struggle with in this job?

title: Linker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
it went well, once with group once with individually.
in the interview, they gave me one scenario to solve, and see what's my answer. the scenario was very simple and basic.
Interview Questions:
why did you apply for this job?
what do you know about this job.

title: Student Athlete Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Easy/quick, interview with coordinator  of student athletes services overview of position and the rules and regulations involved.  Very nice people then toured the office and study spaces and introduced to how to sign in each day
Interview Questions: Greatest strengths/weaknesss and how you will use them

title: Sourcing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University (Arlington, VA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was typical tell me about a time question with the STAR method similar to what most companies are looking for in an interview response.  They are friendly and welcoming and open to new and innovative thought processes and ideas. Very refreshing experience.
Interview Questions: Why choose James Madison University?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: resume review was the key to everything, after getting your resume reviewed and got the in person interview, everything should be much easier. you do not get to negotiate the salary a lot here. this is still a institutional org
Interview Questions: they asked a lot about your education

title: LINKers Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: first-round group interview with a scenario analysis or several open-ended questions and then with a second-round individual interview with a several of scenario analysis and open-ended questions, most questions are asking about what's your personality or how's is your teamworking skills, etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply for this position?

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took one day.  Visited the marketing office, went over the position and my qualifications, answered a few questions, then left.  By the end of the day, I received an offer via email and was in the office by the next week going over orientation materials.
Interview Questions: What experiences have given you the skills to be successful in this position.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Teacher approached me since I excelled in the course and enjoyed the material. I have a passion for the subject, an outgoing personality, and had been observed explaining items to my lab mates. These are the reasons why I believe the teacher approached me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Major Gifts Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: long, repetitive and arduous. Very formal and unrestorative process for a large organization. Seemed like the interview process was too long and too labor intensive. The complete process took over 8 hours and there was no water etc provided for all of the talking.
Interview Questions: describe a time you overcame an obstacle

title: Machinist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at James Madison University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Simple, relaxed, short essay, for a chill interview. They ask very simple questions about your background and want to know you did well on the lathe and mill tests. Super easy, take your time, gotta love.
Interview Questions: What experience with manufacturing did you have

title: Admissions Host Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Incredibly smooth and straight forward process with details regarding next steps. Interviewer could not have been any sweeter. They truly want what is best for the University and the community.
Interview Questions: Please describe your past experiences.

title: Administrative Assistant - College of Visual Arts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked to interview in person. I was given incorrect parking instructions, and couldn't find the interview room, and arrived late and panting from walking up multiple flights of stairs - make sure you arrive SUPER early if you are unfamiliar with campus!!

I walked into a room with about four senior level employees, all seated around a large conference table. The took turns asking me questions about my involvement with the arts and my experience with the role. 

The questions didn't seem to have any logical order, and I felt it was a very poor interview. I was in a swivel chair on wheels, and had trouble keeping it still.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with this position?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I asked a professor how I could gain some valuable skills in the field, I was studying and they offered me the position.  It wasn't very formal, mostly because I had developed rapport with this professor before.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my research skills and what I hoped to learn from the position.

title: Media Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Fill out a survey application that asked questions about my experience. I then was told to come in for an in person interview. I was interviewed by two executives about my experience and provided a portfolio for them to review.
Interview Questions: What were my aspirations?

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with a panel of the analysts. They ask you about your workload, see how much you know about computers (super basic, like what operating systems do you know of?) and ending in a roleplay phone scenario
Interview Questions: What operating systems are you familiar with?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of reaching out to STEM majors to  gauge interest level from incoming freshman. If interested, you then had to write an essay that would be reviewed. From there, a phone interview was conducted regarding availability for the position.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to use your STEM education to help society in the future?

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: It was comfortable and intuitive.  There were no tough questions and I was confident leaving that I could contribute and it would be appreciated.  I am appreciative of the experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: I had a panel phone interview that lasted about an half hour and was then offered the job in a later phone call.  Questions about my programming experiences were asked.  Also about my supervision style and how I would handle multiple styles of resident advisors.  Additionally my previous experiences were addressed and how they related to the Graduate Hall Director position.
Interview Questions: What is your supervision style?

title: The Centennial Scholars Program, CSP At JMU Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was very relaxed to be honest. It was very short and straight forward, less than 10 minutes. Mine was 7 minutes some people even had 5 mins.The interviewers were 2 alumni of the program, 1 graduate from JMU and the program director. So 4, or 5 i think I forgot one person. They made it feel more like a conversation than an interview, just be extremely confident in what you have to say. The key is answering the question directly, not going on about a story every time they ask you something. GOOD LUCK. BE CONFIDENT.
Interview Questions:
Why do you need this financial aid?
What would you bring into this program?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the JMU recruitment website, simply had to submit a cover letter and short resume. The interview was with the Building Manager for the Student Success Center that I was applying to be an assistant in as well as the building's scheduler. Talked a lot about myself and what I put on my resume. Turns out the guys love soccer so we talked about that for a little which eased the tension a lot!
Interview Questions: How can your major help me and my colleague better do our job?

title: PASS Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: In order to be considered, you must first have a faculty member vouch for you. Some departments will have a GPA minimum in specific coursework related to the class. Usually a 3.5 for a specific course. If you achieve these requirements, there will be a 20 - 30 minute interview.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard questions: How do you think someone for this position should act and is acting to improve classroom learning?

title: Early Literacy Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by three current senior staff members in the department. They go around and each ask questions in a "round robin" approach for the interview questions. Writing down your responses on their own question sheets.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Assignments Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: Arrive 30 minutes early to afford time to find parking, have a positive attitude and exert as much energy as you can muster. Diversity is a very big part of the education system there, so learn what it is, and make it a large reason for your employment search there. If you are not supportive of LGBT rights, this is not the place for you!
Interview Questions: How do you feel about homosexuals?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a hiring committee of 4 people, who were all very knowledgeable about their department. Two were extremely nice and social. The interview process was an initial phone interview and a secondary follow-up  interview "in person" that was an all-day interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked the favorite thing I had ever written, which surprised me, since I had turned in three writing samples of my favorites, and had said on my resume I had 11 years of professional writing experience.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews - one with an office staff member, and one with a hall director. I really enjoyed both interviews.  They were more of a conversation than an interview.  They asked questions about handing conflict, diversity issues, working with groups, time management, etc.
Interview Questions: Specific questions about diversity - like how we would address issues facing a resident from another country

title: GIS Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a basic question/answer. They asked about related project's I had worked on, what software I had used, and went over aspects of my resume for clarification. There were a few technical staff members and an HR representative in the room. Most of the questions were technical. They asked about a lot of past projects and ability to manage projects and collect data to understand and identify workflows. Overall it was an easy interview.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with all of the software used by this position (ArcGIS Suite).

title: Chemistry Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA)
Interview Descriptions: in need of an instructor immediately.
Interview Questions: not even ask for graduate transcripts

title: Centennial Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA)
Interview Descriptions:
To be interviewed, you must write a simple one page essay on the following three questions: 1.	What academic, social, and emotional challenges do you anticipate as a JMU student?
2.	What do you expect to gain from the Centennial Scholars Program?  What do you expect to contribute?  And, how do you think it will support your educational goals and plans?
3.	Please explain your perceived academic strengths and weaknesses.

The interview portion is much more difficult however, it is always a board room full of graduate students as well as the director of the program (usually totals about 10 or more people) and the questions are ones that you may not initially anticipate. Make sure that you know information about the program besides the scholarship money that you will receive.
Interview Questions: Know about obstacles you have overcome and have several weaknesses prepared and how you dealt with them in a positive way

title: Residence Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was a process of three jnterviews, two of which are one-on-one, and the final is with three interviewers. The first two are the preliminary interviews, where they decide to eliminate unwanted contestants. After those two, you are sent an email declaring if you moved forward or were cut. If you move forward, then you would have the group jnterview, to see how you handle working with others. If you passed that, then you were an R.A..
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? How would you connect with a student of another culture? If two students were having problems and one was from another culture, how would you handle this? If one student was having a problem about race with another student, what would you do? If you found out students were drinking, what would you do?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Submit materials, phone interview, on-campus interview with lots and lots of interview sessions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by all day interview.  Given tour of office, was interviewed by the entire staff, the Search Committee, taken to lunch,  Met with leadership team and was asked to respond to two case studies.  Then was interviewed by leadership team.  Met with the director and given a campus tour.
Interview Questions: What would make you feel valued in your workplace?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with the department chair and she simply asked questions about my experience. Then I taught a class with one faculty member present. This wasn't so bad and was fairly easy relative to tenure-track professor interviews.
Interview Questions: What's your teaching methodology?

title: Technical Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university website. The interview process was very laid back. Two supervisors were present at the interview. They ask you a lot of "what if" questions and give you different scenarios and ask you questions about them. I got offered the job as soon as my interview was over.
Interview Questions: They gave a scenario and you had to put things in order of importance.

title: Donation Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about you with a mock phone call. Its a very simple process. Just show up, be yourself, and act sociable. Don't be shy, your job entails you talking all night to people who really dont want to discuss anything with you.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry doner?

title: Informal Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Group interview with full-time staff and some of the managers
Asked about twenty questions, basic stuff like strengths and weaknesses with one question to throw you off
Everyone is friendly and didn't make me feel stressed
Interview Questions: If you could have lunch with anyone dead or alive who would it be?

title: Intramural Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the professional staff and some of the other site managers which can be intimidating. Just be yourself and do your homework, there are some situation questions   Ask some of the site managers about the interview process and what they are looking for, the site managers will be happy to provide info.
Interview Questions: What is the UREC mission?

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at James Madison University in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: A Friend told me about the position and helped me get the interview. It was easy enough to get in contact with them and to work in the interview around my class schedule. The interviewers were extremely laid back, and finished off the interview asking for a joke.
Interview Questions: Why do you pick JMU for your degree?

title: Writing Center Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at James Madison University (Harrisonburg, VA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: First I had to take the semester long tutor training class as a mandatory pre qualification to be able to apply for the job. The class was very helpful and I learned a lot. The director of the writing center taught our class so he got to know us pretty well before the actual application/interview process. Then I submitted a resume and got invited to interview. It was a panel interview with the director of the writing center and several other staff members. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions- strengths/weaknesses, situational, etc.
